Introduction to Javascript | Code Equality

Introduction to Javascript

An introductory hands-on course for students curious about web development with HTML/CSS and Javascript.

May 24, 2014 9am-1pm iTrain M'sia, E-7-1, Block E, Megan Avenue 1

Event poster

What is this?

This is an introductory hands-on course for students curious about web development with HTML/CSS and Javascript.

When and where is this happening?

DateMay 24th, 2014 (Saturday)
Time 9am-1pm
Venue iTrain Malaysia, E-7-1, Block E, Megan Avenue 1, Jalan Tun Razak (Near Ampang Park LRT Station), Kuala Lumpur

How do I sign up?

Head on over to the event sign up page over here. This is a free for all event.

What will we be doing?

We’ll be building a simple “to-do” list like the one below. This will introduce you to the basics of HTML/CSS and Javascript.

Is this for me?

Yes! You do not need previous coding or design experience, just bring yourself, a laptop and enthusiasm to learn. This class is suitable for beginners.

What do I need to bring?

You just have to bring your laptop and charger for this class.

Who’s teaching this class?

Our volunteer instructor for this class is Nguyen Vu Nguyen.

Nguyen is a Lead Engineer at Says.com. He is a full stack developer with many years of building scalable web applications. He has a passion for learning new languages, tools and methodologies for solving real problems and teaching what he learned. He believes in education as the great equalizer.

How do I get there?

The iTrain building is close to KLCC and within walkable distance from the Ampang Park LRT station. If you are coming from Ampang Park LRT, use the the Bank of China/ Intermark exit. Walk towards Bank of China (with Intermark behind you).

Who are you guys? And why are you doing this?

To find out more about Code Equality, check out our About section.

I have more questions!

Feel free to contact us at hello@CodeEquality.org. Please give us 24 hours to respond to your enquires.
